text: ‘Operant conditioning focuses on the consequences of a behavior -to change an undesirable behavior involves changing the consequences of the behavior POSITIVE REINFORCEMENT - used to encourage or maintain a behavior (e.g., notice and praise good behavior) NONREIENFORCEMENT AND EXTINCTION - use to discourage unwanted behavior, emove any reinforcers (e.g, ignoring tantrums) -Ifa reinforcer does not follow the behavior,the behavior will occur less frequently and eventually go away - Often the unwanted behavior increases before it decreases, often is an attempt to double down behavior in rder o lict previous outcome. PUNISHMENT - follow undesirable behavior with immediate negative or unpleasant consequence (e.g. loss o privlege) (USE SPARINGLY) 'SHAPING - Gradually working towards desired behavior i smallincrements ‘TOKEN ECONOMY — rewarding with tokens or symbolic rewards
